p: The results of variance of all treatment data showed that the S. aureus count increased significantly ( p ≤ .05) during storage time (Figure 1c). The increase in microbial load in the samples containing the coating increased with a slower gradient. Djenane et al. ( 2012) investigated the effects of lavender and peppermint essential oil on S. aureus and Escherichia coli count in minced beef. Their results showed that both essential oils were able to prevent the growth of S. aureus and E. coli in minced meat samples compared to the control sample.
